title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: outlines propose change bushtucker.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: ’ve found bug inconsistency data, please file issue outlines exactly issue - ideally table, row number(s) column name(s). See tidyverse guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("chrisbrownlie/bushtucker", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to bushtucker
text: Please note bushtucker project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here' Data
title: Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here' Data
text: {bushtucker} data package provides datasets 24 seasons UK TV show “’m Celebrity, Get ”, spanning 2002 2024 broadcast ITV. show follows group UK celebrities camping Australian rainforest (Welsh castle seasons 20-21, due COVID) several weeks, completing physical mental endurance challenges earn meals treats. challenges called ‘Bushtucker Trials’, hence name package. information format can found show’s Wikipedia pages, also data package comes .

title: Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here' Data
text: can install development version bushtucker like :

title: Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here' Data
text: 6 key datasets included package: seasons: one row 24 seasons, includes info location, presenters dates contestants: one row per contestant per season, includes info occupation, final position trial performance results: one row per contestant per vote, includes season date, whether contestant eliminated vote, well share vote received (available) trials: one row per trial, includes season, name, episode, contestant(s) took part performed challenges: one row per challenge (Celebrity Chest, Dingo Dollar, Castle Coin Deals Wheels), includes season, episode, contestant(s) took part, whether campmates got question correct prize received ratings: one row per episode, includes total viewership weekly ranking episode can see snapshot dataset.
code: library(bushtucker) library(pillar) # for glimpse()  seasons |>   tail() |>   glimpse() #> Rows: 6 #> Columns: 11 #> $ season               <dbl> 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24 #> $ contestants episodes             <dbl> 22, 20, 19, 22, 22, 22 #> $ start_date           <date> 2019-11-17, 2020-11-15, 2021-11-21, 2022-11-06, 2… #> $ end_date             <date> 2019-12-08, 2020-12-04, 2021-12-12, 2022-11-27, 2… #> $ winner               <chr> "Jacqueline Jossa", "Giovanna Fletcher", "Danny M… #> $ runner_up            <chr> "Andy Whyment", "Jordan North", "Simon Gregson",… #> $ third_place          <chr> "Roman Kemp", "Vernon Kay", "Frankie Bridge", "M… #> $ avg_viewers_millions <dbl> 10.59, 11.05, 7.61, 10.94, 8.36, 8.63  contestants |>   tail() |>   glimpse() #> Rows: 6 #> Columns: 12 #> $ season            <dbl> 24, 24, 24, 24, 24, 24 #> $ first_name        <chr> "Maura", "Barry", "Melvin", "Tulisa", "Dean", "Jane" #> $ nickname          <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA #> $ last_name         <chr> "Higgins", "McGuigan", "Odoom", "Tulisa", "McCulloug… #> $ famous_for        <chr> "Television personality & model", "Former profession… #> $ position          <dbl> 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12 #> $ position_desc     <chr> "Eliminated 6th", "Eliminated 5th", "Eliminated 4th"… #> $ date_eliminated   <date> 2024-12-05, 2024-12-05, 2024-12-03, 2024-12-02, 2024… #> $ trials_attempted  <dbl> 4, 4, 1, 2, 7, 1 #> $ stars_available   <dbl> 25, 0, 12, 23, 0, 12 #> $ stars_won         <dbl> 18, 0, 12, 16, 0, 6 #> $ trial_performance <dbl> 0.7200000, NA, 1.0000000, 0.6956522, NA, 0.5000000  results |>   tail() |>   glimpse() #> Rows: 6 #> Columns: 7 #> $ season     <dbl> 24, 24, 24, 24, 24, 24 #> $ day        <dbl> 22, 22, 22, 22, 22, 22 #> $ vote       <dbl> 9, 9, 9, 9, 9, 9 2024-12-05, 2024-12-05, 2024-12-06, 2024-12-07, 2024-1… #> $ name            <chr> "Arcade of Agony: Battle Blocks", "Arcade of Agony: Fa… #> $ live            <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, title: IACGMOOH celebrity challenges data — challenges
text: Data celebrity challenges (Celebrity Chest, Dingo Dollar, Castle Coin Deals Wheels) first 24 seasons UK TV show "Celebrity, Get "

title: IACGMOOH celebrity challenges data — challenges
text: data frame 134 rows 7 columns: season (numeric) Season show episode (numeric) Episode challenge occurred date (Date) Date challenge took place (available) contestant (character) First name(s) contestant(s) took part challenge. multiple contestants, separated semi-colon. prizes_available (character) prize(s) offer completion challenge. challenges competing contestants given choice one prize options - cases options separated semi-colon. prize (character) prize(s) offer, either contestants chose , prize offer. question (character) Outcome question gets asked non-participating celebrities. One : 'correct' non-participants answered correctly won prize; 'incorrect' non-participants answered incorrectly forfeited prize; 'not_asked' question asked non-participants (outcome challenges decided means).

title: IACGMOOH ratings data — ratings
text: data frame 458 rows 6 columns: season (numeric) Season show episode (numeric) Episode season date (Date) Date episode aired viewership_millions (numeric) total reported viewership episode millions, including ITV HD ITV+1 available weekly_uk_tv_rank (numeric) Available seasons 1-9, episode ranked among shows UK TV week weekly_itv_rank (numeric) Available seasons 10-24, episode ranked among shows ITV week

title: IACGMOOH voting results data — results
